description: 1987 BENTLEY CONTINENTAL CONVERTIBLE for sale. Prestigious Euro Cars is proud to present this exquisite 1986 Bentley Continental Convertible featured in very rare Cream with Tan leather interior and matching Tan convertible top and boot cover. The body is highlighted by fine tan pinstriping. The Tan convertible top and Tan boot are as-new.The Bentley Continental Convertible is very rare compared to the corresponding Rolls Corniche Convertible, and it is considered more desirable because of its understated front end styling and Bentleys sporting heritage. Between 1985 and 1989 a total of only 195 Continental Convertibles were sold worldwide, of which a small percentage came to the United States. Historic data and value guides show that the Continental brings a substantial premium over its Rolls Corniche cousin.Our car has been cherished and dealer-maintained since new, and has covered only 9787 miles. Our car also has the desirable Cocktail Set option built into both front doors, and all the pieces of the set are still present. For 1986 the Bentley Continental received the same upgrades that led Rolls-Royce to change the designation of their car to Corniche II. Upgrades include rack and pinion steering, alloy wheels, and bi-level air-conditioning. The car is powered by Rolls renowned 6.75 Liter V-8 with Bosch fuel injection and features a four speed automatic transmission.With their Mulliner Park Ward coachwork, and bespoke quality, the best examples of these fine convertibles will be treasured by collectors for decades to come. This may be the best example of a very rare car in arguably the best color combination. Your inspection is invited.Please call Bob at 954-779-1000 with any questions that you may have,You can buy with confidence, we are Bentley and Rolls Royce specialists for over 35 years. This fine car is sold with 12 months WARRANTY.
title: 1986 Bentley Continental

description: 1962 Bentley S2 Continental Park Ward Convertible Left-Hand-DriveThis Bentley S2 Continental Park Ward Convertible LHD is an extremely desirable car in excellent restored condition. Burgundy with Tan Leather Interior and a Tan Top. This beautiful original California car was once owned by Nicholas Cage and is one of the finest S2 Continental Convertibles that you could possibly find. It is equipped with Power Brakes, Power Steering, Power Windows, Power Top, and Air-Conditioning. Excellent paint, interior, and top. The underside of the car is rust free and is in excellent condition. Only 388 S2 Continentals were produced, a third of which were Drop Head Coupes, and only 20 Drop Head Coupes were built with Left Hand Drive and delivered to the United States. The rarity of this car coupled with its unique provenance makes it one of the best Bentley S2 Continentals available.Chassis: BC22LBY -Previously owned by Nicolas Cage -One of just 20 Drop Head Coupes built with LHD and delivered to the US-Quality restoration Price:​​ $225,000

description: Up for sale is a timeless and very elegant NUMBERS MATCHING 1963 Bentley Continental S3 Coupe, also known as “Chinese Eye”!!

During its course of production, there were ONLY 311 Continental S3’s  built (291 by H.J. Mulliner Park Ward and 20 by James Young) and this beauty is one of them. Entire body was handcrafted from Aluminium making them HIGHLY DESIRABLE for collectors!
What makes this Bentley special is that it comes with a very rare Sunroof option! Not a lot of S3’s came with it!

This particular S3 was imported to Florida from UK in 1976 by prominent local Dentist who had endless love for British luxury cars!! He owned this car from 1976 (41 years!). He flew to London in summer of ‘76, and came home to US with few newly acquired Rolls-Royce’s and Bentley’s!
All original Import paperwork is present as well as the original bill of sale when he purchased this Bentley in UK!
Original UK registration is present as well, documenting ownership of every individual who owned this beautiful car throughout its lifetime!

First owner was Sir William J. Lithgow, 2nd Baronet - a Scottish industrialist and vice-chairman of Lithgow Group. In 1952 he inherited the Scottish shipbuilding company, Lithgows, which was established by his grandfather, William Lithgow. At the time, it was the largest private shipbuilding concern in the world! This ownership is also documented in the book by marque expert Martin Bennett “Bentley Continental – Corniche & Azure 1951-2002” (please see picture!)

As soon as it was imported to US, its new owner wanted to refresh this beauty back to its original condition, as its original color was changed couple of times to suite the tastes of its previous owners!

Car was taken apart, paint was stripped, body was primered and got ready for paint, original and number matching engine was pulled out, taken apart completely and rebuilt (new crank, new cam shaft, new pistons, connecting rods, valves, etc.), original new parts were ordered for whatever the car needed,including the aftermarket A/C system for those hot Florida days!! It was in full swing to be assembled, and back on the road, and then life happened!! It was parked into storage with few other cars that were also in the process of being reconditioned, and forgotten for over 40 years!! Good storage and warm Florida climate preserved this Continental! Attached is the picture of how we found it, covered in decades of dust!

This Bentley appears to be all complete and it makes a perfect candidate for completing the restoration that was started decades ago, especially after the hardest part of disassembling the car, and rebuilding the original engine is already done!!! Original body is very straight, as well as the original and unmolested undercarriage!
Original glass is all complete, with no cracks in the windows. Original selling Bentley and Rolls-Royce dealer sticker “Frank Dale & Stepsons” is still affixed to its original windshield!

Interior is complete as well, and in remarkably preserved condition (especially after being stored for 40+ years), including the fine leather seats, and wood paneling, especially around the dash and instrument gauges!
Original Vinyl roof shows no signs of shrinkage, and this beauty comes equipped with very rare sunroof!!

It comes with all the documents from the first owner in 1963 when it was purchased new to Summer of 1976 when this car was purchased and Imported to United States by its new owner who owned it for 40+ years! It even comes with its original British License Plate (KHS 438D) that is documented on the Import paperwork and original registration!! (Please See Pictures).

All numbers (Chassis # BC84XB, and Motor # 42BBC), are documented and matching not only through the original registration card and other documentation, but also through the Bentley Continental book by Rolls-Royce and Bentley expert and guru Martin Bennett which will be included with this car!!!
WE SHIP AND EXPORT
title: 1963 Bentley Continental

description: 1973 Bentley continental T1Â  fuel: gasÂ  title status: cleanÂ  transmission: automaticÂ  The car has gone a thorough restoration from paint to brakes to interior and more. currently the car has an issue with on brake and is at a garage. had the car stripped and repainted new bumpers put on it new calipers fuel pump engine service etc. the list is very long. The car is beautiful and once the brake issue is fixed it can be driven normally. I am asking 12k or best offer. A clean running driving restored one goes for well over the 20's. I simply am strapped and need the monies I also can't wait for the shop where its at to finish it as its been there for months and I'm getting the run around. I have all of the books for service. If you are a mechanic or handy, fix it yourself! It's a beautiful car and a true delight to drive; t it's somewhere between 55 and 65K. This is the last year for the chrome bumpers, its the same year I believe John Lennon had. These are not easy to find in good running driving shape. title: 1973 Bentley Continental

description: This Bentley has been religiously maintained by a reputable Palm Beach Art Collector. Service Records ( available with Rolls Royce or Bentley Grill ) He has owned her for 8 years, He gave us all the receipts for any work that has been done over that time. The conversion to the 350 Chevrolet Engine, Jaguar Front and Rear Suspension and Brakes was done . The odometer stopped at 85,000 miles. She starts right up, she has had a new carburetor installed and all tuned up. Her large white wall tires show off a great look........ She has driven her about 10,000 miles during her ownership her beauty and the after market A/C blows ice cold and strong. Power windows, right hand drive. Wipers, horn and lights, blinker lights all work. This rolling work of art, Bentley S 3 is so easy to maintain! Any certified mechanic can easily access her 350 cubic inch Chevrolet Engine. All the fun of a Bentley/Rolls Royce without the $5000.00 brake job! Great paint, chrome and body............

description: Champion Motors International is pleased to present a very nice 1955 early Bentley S1. The car currently has 74,683 miles and has been owned by a Rolls Royce Owners Club member since 2011.  Over $16,000 has been spent in repairs in last 7 years including a complete brake job, rebuilt shocks, new fuel pump, coil, and complete new stainless steel exhaust system. All accessories are functioning properly. The car starts instantly and runs great.  The tan leather and wool carpeting show nicely and the woodwork is in exceptional original condition.  The original AM radio is present and works!  The next owner will enjoy driving this beautiful world class Bentley from the 1950s and is a really great value at $37,500. The car comes with owners manual and large and small tools. Please contact Howard Krimko at 516-233-9708 with any questions you may have.
title: 1955 Bentley S1

description: Offered for sale is this absolutely stunning example of the first generation T1 Sedan from Bentley, a 1966 model in classic Black over Palomino Hides.Â  This very original sedan is an older restoration, and looks, runs, and drives extremely well.Â  The paint looks very presentable from front to back, although there is some patina in the form of cracking and corrosion behind the rear right fender. The interior is in remarkably good condition, with clean, rich, soft leather that smells terrific, and burl wood in unusually good condition. Underneath is very solid, and the car has far less corrosion that one might expect from an older British car. Mechanically, the 6.2 liter V8 runs exceptionally well, and the 4-speed automatic shifts properly. The chrome and brightwork is very nice, and the car goes down the road extremely well.Â  It is beautiful to look at, fun to drive, and attainable in price - a terrific vehicle to have for Sunday drives.Â  For more information, please phone us at (239) 649-7300 for sales information.
For a real walk around and test drive of this vehicle, please see our YouTube video:
https://youtu.be/aLKXMYRwCRA

title: 1961 Bentley S2

description: Very rare 1961 Bentley S2 Continental James Young edition. Factory LHD which makes this vehicle that much harder to come by. Completed in Black with Magnolia leather interior and light tan carpets. Absolutely stunning inside and out. A true coach built vehicle with amazing lines and details. This can not be compared to a MPW, there are only 6 left hand drive James Youngs' ever built. Most often James Young coach built cars are the most sought after and desirable.  It does have the original tool kit, as well as a folder full of build construction and test documents from when this Continental was being built. It is an original European delivery to Switzerland and built for show at the 1961 Geneva Auto Show w/documentation. This lovely Continental also enjoy entry into rally in Switzerland several years ago where the car was shipped back to Europe to participate in the rally and under went extensive re commissioning to do so.  It has spent it's more recent years here is southern California. It has been restored with both the engine bay and under carriage showing great attention to detail.  Runs and drives excellent. A rather important Continental with great documentation and history.   Call for complete details. ** SHOWN BY APPOINTMENT ONLY **
title: 1961 Bentley Continental
